item.description:
Director Jean-Pierre Melville was a member of the French Resistance in World War II . While acknowledged for his great film-noirs, it took him over 20 years to finally create this film about the German occupancy of France. It was never released in the U.S. until last year and appeared on many "Top Ten" lists for 2006.
"The title, which refers to the French Resistance, will mean nothing to most people, ...that will be a waste, since any moviegoers with a weakness for dry heroism, dark-toned humor, and storytelling of pantherish pace and grace,in short, lovers of cinema,should reach for their fedoras, turn up the collars of their coats, and sneak to this picture through a mist of rain." The New Yorker
Here is a complete review:
http://rogerebert.sun...

Tom will be holding a Meetup sign after the movie and then we will go to a local restaurant to discuss.
item.name: "Army of Shadows" as Group Event
